active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs between usability (e.g., seamless single sign-on across subdomains) and security (e.g., strict subdomain isolation). Provide real-world examples from OWASP Top 10 breaches and propose a balanced policy.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Plausible but incorrect: Based on common errors (e.g., confuse SameSite=Lax with Strict).
Frequency: 40% factual inversion, 30% partial truth, 30% unrelated concept.
Avoid: Obvious wrongs; ensure 70% learner approval test pass rate simulation.
Variety: 60% MCQ (4 options), 20% true/false with explanation, 20% ordering/matching.

Topic: Cross-subdomain Session Hijacking (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Penetration Testing And Ethical Hacking > Web Application Penetration Testing > 007_005_Session Management Testing > Session Hijacking > Cross-subdomain Session Hijacking). Consensus: 70% approval from 7 voters emphasizing Bloom's Taxonomy, 4-layer scaffolding, completeness (full attack steps, mitigations), prerequisites, and concept maps. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [PASTE FULL LIST HERE] - Active Learning: [PASTE FULL HERE] - Scaffolding: [PASTE FULL 4 LAYERS HERE] - Research: Cross-subdomain hijacking exploits cookie Domain=.example.com sharing across subdomains (e.g., blog to shop); vectors: XSS theft, replay; mitigations: SameSite=Strict, subdomain isolation (OWASP A05/A07). Generate 75 flashcards following this EXACT schema per card: { 'id': 1, 'front': 'Question text...', 'back': { 'answer': 'Correct answer...', 'explanation': 'Detailed... (link to objective/layer)...', 'distractors': ['Opt A', 'Opt B', 'Opt C'], 'bloom_level': 'APPLY', 'scaffolding_layer': 'Layer 3', 'active_learning_link': 'Discussion prompt example...' } } Output ONLY a JSON array of these objects.
